questions.text: In object-oriented analysis, an object is a member of a _____, which is a collection of similar objects.
questions.explanation: In object-oriented analysis, a class defines a group of similar objects that share common attributes and methods.

questions.text: Which of the following is likely to be a mission-critical system?
questions.explanation: Mission-critical systems are essential to an organisation’s operations, such as email servers that support communication.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes schedule feasibility?
options: The time frame required for implementing the system
The effectiveness of the proposed system after development
The technical resources and people available for the project
The estimated costs of the proposed system
questions.correctAnswer: The time frame required for implementing the system
questions.explanation: Schedule feasibility evaluates if the project can be completed within the required time frame.

questions.text: _____ includes ongoing support and maintenance costs, as well as acquisition costs.
questions.explanation: Total cost of ownership considers the full lifecycle cost of a system, including support, maintenance, and acquisition.

questions.text: Which of the following is likely to be a system request?
options: A request for additional server maintenance.
A request for a new feature in an existing software application.
A request for a printer repair service.
A request for a software training program.
questions.correctAnswer: A request for a new feature in an existing software application.
questions.explanation: A system request initiates the process to add, modify, or enhance a system or feature.

questions.text: A _____ graphically displays one or more business processes, such as handling an airline reservation or updating a customer account.
questions.explanation: A BPM diagram visually represents workflows to help understand and improve business processes.

questions.text: _____ usually focus on long-term challenges and goals, the importance of stakeholders, and a commitment to the firm’s role as a corporate citizen.
questions.explanation: Mission statements define a company’s purpose, values, and long-term direction.

questions.text: How does blockchain technology improve supply chain management?
options: It creates new industries and technologies, such as smartphones and apps.
It provides an efficient, secure, and transparent distributed ledger system.
It enables just-in-time (JIT) inventory systems and EDI relationships.
It reshapes existing business operations through the Internet-of-Things.
questions.correctAnswer: It provides an efficient, secure, and transparent distributed ledger system.
questions.explanation: Blockchain ensures transparent and tamper-proof tracking of goods and transactions in supply chains.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of summarising results and recommendations in a preliminary investigation?
options: To develop strong communication skills as a systems analyst
To estimate the costs and benefits of the proposed project
To convey information to management through a report or presentation
To evaluate the feasibility of the system request
questions.correctAnswer: To convey information to management through a report or presentation
questions.explanation: The summary allows management to make informed decisions about continuing or rejecting the project.

questions.text: Which of the following is not likely to be a user productivity system?
questions.explanation: Database management software supports backend data handling rather than end-user productivity.

questions.text: Identify a method of developing systems that is well-suited to traditional project management tools and techniques.
questions.explanation: Structured analysis follows a step-by-step linear process, aligning well with traditional project management.

questions.text: In a _____ model, the result of each phase is called a deliverable, which flows into the next phase.
questions.explanation: The waterfall model completes one phase before moving to the next, producing deliverables at each step.

questions.text: Which of the following is most likely to be a function of a systems review committee?
options: Assessing the feasibility of implementing new technologies.
Conducting regular audits of organisational systems.
Reviewing and approving proposed changes to existing systems.
Identifying and resolving issues related to system performance.
questions.correctAnswer: Reviewing and approving proposed changes to existing systems.
questions.explanation: A systems review committee evaluates system change requests to ensure alignment with business goals.

questions.text: To avoid the problem of _____, a project’s scope should be defined as clearly as possible.
questions.explanation: Project creep occurs when additional features or changes are added beyond the original plan.

questions.text: _____ technology uses high-frequency radio waves to track physical objects.
questions.explanation: RFID tags and readers use radio signals to identify and track objects automatically.

questions.text: What is the difference between top managers and middle managers in organisational information models?
options: Top managers have a broader scope of authority compared to middle managers.
Top managers focus on strategic decision-making, while middle managers focus on tactical decision-making.
Top managers are responsible for day-to-day operations, while middle managers handle long-term planning.
Top managers have access to more detailed information than middle managers.
questions.correctAnswer: Top managers focus on strategic decision-making, while middle managers focus on tactical decision-making.
questions.explanation: Strategic management sets direction, while middle management focuses on operational execution.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of an ERP system?
questions.explanation: ERP integrates core business functions, automating workflows across departments.

questions.text: Which of the following is likely to be an internal factor affecting systems projects?
questions.explanation: Internal factors originate within the organisation, such as workforce limitations.

questions.text: The overall aim of a _____ is to avoid seeking goals that are unrealistic, unprofitable, or unachievable.
options: SWOT (strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats) analysis
SWCT (strategy, weakness, cost, and technology) analysis
questions.correctAnswer: SWOT (strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats) analysis
questions.explanation: SWOT analysis helps organisations assess realistic goals and areas for improvement.

questions.text: What are the main yardsticks used in a feasibility study?
options: Desirability, technical resources, economic desirability, and time frame
Operational feasibility, economic feasibility, technical feasibility, and schedule feasibility
Proposal, benefits, ease of use, and tech resources
questions.correctAnswer: Operational feasibility, economic feasibility, technical feasibility, and schedule feasibility
questions.explanation: Feasibility studies evaluate if a project is practical, cost-effective, and achievable within time limits.

questions.text: Strategic planning starts with a _____ that reflects a firm’s vision, purpose, and values.
questions.explanation: Strategic planning begins with a mission statement defining the company’s purpose and direction.

questions.text: Which type of feasibility will likely try to determine whether legal issues need to be considered?
questions.explanation: Operational feasibility assesses practical constraints, including legal and ethical considerations.

questions.text: _____ result from a decrease in expenses, an increase in revenues, or both.
questions.explanation: Tangible benefits are measurable improvements such as cost savings or revenue increases.

questions.text: What is most likely to be the function of a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system?
options: Tracking inventory levels and stock movements.
Analysing market trends and consumer behaviour.
Storing and organising customer data for improved customer interactions and relationship management.
questions.correctAnswer: Storing and organising customer data for improved customer interactions and relationship management.
questions.explanation: CRM systems manage customer information to improve relationships and retention.

questions.text: What is the purpose of just-in-time (JIT) inventory systems?
options: To provide efficient, secure, and transparent supply chain management.
To minimise unnecessary inventory by relying on computer-to-computer data exchange.
To track food safety from grower to consumer using blockchain technology.
To improve operations for customers by using blockchain technology.
questions.correctAnswer: To minimise unnecessary inventory by relying on computer-to-computer data exchange.
questions.explanation: JIT inventory systems reduce costs by ensuring goods are received only as needed.

questions.text: During the ______ phase the IT staff maintains, enhances and protects the system.
questions.explanation: In the support and security phase, IT ensures continued system performance and safety.

questions.text: What is the function of transaction processing systems?
options: To manage employee payroll and benefits.
To automate business processes and workflows.
To track and record day-to-day business transactions.
To facilitate data analysis and decision making.
questions.correctAnswer: To track and record day-to-day business transactions.
questions.explanation: Transaction processing systems handle the daily operations that record routine transactions.

questions.text: Projects that provide the _____ are assigned the highest priority when setting priorities for systems requests.
options: greatest benefit, at the highest cost, in the shortest period of time
least benefit, at the lowest cost, in the longest period of time
least benefit, at the highest cost, in the longest period of time
greatest benefit, at the lowest cost, in the shortest period of time
questions.correctAnswer: greatest benefit, at the lowest cost, in the shortest period of time
questions.explanation: High-priority projects yield the most value quickly and economically.

questions.text: During the _____ of the systems development life cycle (SDLC), a new system is constructed.
questions.explanation: The implementation phase involves building, testing, and deploying the system.

questions.text: Which one of the following systems is normally used to support middle managers?
questions.explanation: Decision support systems assist middle management with data-driven analysis and decision-making.
